data.text: @jeremyrhammond @leftyvegan @andy5912_a See, this is the problem; you were educated on this subject by ignorant people so you think your ignorance is education and our greater understanding of the science is ignorance.

@jeremyrhammond @EclecticRadical @andy5912_a Why are you insisting on reserving that term for immunity through infection, when most scientists (which, to be clear, you're not) don't do that? https://t.co/WP6YAgYndq

@jeremyrhammond @EclecticRadical @andy5912_a Flat out wrong.
Natural immunity=catching the virus. 
Catching the virus means you have to survive the virus and deal with the long term consequences, known to include effects on brain, heart, lungs. As well as perpetuate the contagion to others.

Your tweet is nonsense.

@jeremyrhammond @EclecticRadical @andy5912_a If YOU were paying attention, you'd know that there have been dozens of studies that have looked at this, and that they often don't come out the way that the one or two you know about did that led you to mistakenly conclude that "natural" immunity was better.

@jeremyrhammond @EclecticRadical @andy5912_a What he knows is that "natural immunity" is terminology that misleads a lot of people like you into thinking it's better, and many scientists argue against using that term to describe immunity resulting from infection. https://t.co/0XYek1CfYJ

@EclecticRadical @jeremyrhammond @hand_to_eye If we developed a nasal "vaccine" that was just Covid you sprayed in someone's nose and they got Covid, according to those who believe there's such thing as natural immunity versus unnatural immunity, what would this be? https://t.co/sf6jALPTqn
@jeremyrhammond @leftyvegan @andy5912_a Why are you credulously falling for ridiculous pseudoscience about “natural immunity?”

@jeremyrhammond @hand_to_eye @EclecticRadical @andy5912_a Am I misreading or are you contradicting yourself?

"You surely know that natural immunity…. Is not the same as immunity induced by vaccination" https://t.co/9yEvTYFOpy

@jeremyrhammond @hand_to_eye @EclecticRadical This guy thinks your immune system knows the difference between covid and something that mimics covid, and places them in different categories: one natural and one unnatural. No, your immune system is responds to an invader whether it's something that mimics covid or actual covid
